name: Paperless-ngx
description: Paperless-ngx is a document management system that transforms your physical documents into a searchable online archive so you can keep, well, less paper.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_URL
environment-variables.description: The URL paperless will be available at.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_PORT
environment-variables.description: The port paperless will be available at.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_TIME_ZONE
environment-variables.description: Paperless requires you to configure the current time zone correctly. Otherwise, the dates of your documents may appear off by one day

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_DATABASE_BACKEND
environment-variables.description: Paperless supports three database backends: MariaDB, SQLite and PostgreSQL. The default is SQLite, which is the easiest to set up and requires no additional configuration. If you want to use PostgreSQL, you need to set this environment variable to postgresql.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_TIKA_ENABLED
environment-variables.description: Paperless uses Apache Tika to extract text from documents. If you want to use this feature, you need to set this environment variable to true.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_OCR_LANGUAGE
environment-variables.description: Paperless uses Tesseract to perform OCR on images. If you want to use this feature, you need to set this environment variable to the language you want to use. The default is eng, which is the English language. Available: deu eng fra ita spa

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_USERMAP_UID
environment-variables.description: Paperless runs as the user paperless by default. If you want to run it as a different user, you need to set this environment variable to the UID of the user you want to run it as. 0 is root UID

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_USERMAP_GID
environment-variables.description: Paperless runs as the user paperless by default. If you want to run it as a different user, you need to set this environment variable to the GID of the user you want to run it as. 0 is root GID

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_TARGET_FOLDER
environment-variables.description: The target folder is used to store the configuration files of paperless

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_DATA_FOLDER
environment-variables.description: The data folder is used to store other data, such as the database of paperless. CAUTION: If specified, you must specify an absolute path starting with / or a relative path starting with ./ here.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_MEDIA_FOLDER
environment-variables.description: The media folder is where paperless stores your documents. CAUTION: If specified, you must specify an absolute path starting with / or a relative path starting with ./ here.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_CONSUME_FOLDER
environment-variables.description: The consume folder is where paperless looks for new documents to import. CAUTION: If specified, you must specify an absolute path starting with / or a relative path starting with ./ here.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_DATABASE_FOLDER
environment-variables.description: The database folder, where your database stores its data. Leave empty to have this managed by docker. CAUTION: If specified, you must specify an absolute path starting with / or a relative path starting with ./ here.

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_USERNAME
environment-variables.description: The username for the admin user

environment-variables.name: PAPERLESS_PASSWORD
environment-variables.description: The password for the admin user
